question:
The bridge player's frequent errors, although frustrating for his partner, were $\(\qquad\)$ his defeat, since none of the competing players could determine, from the cards he played, what cards he likely held-a necessary prerequisite to figuring out how to block his plays.
Two Answers
A. an insurance against
B. the reason for
C. an indication of
D. an obstacle to
E. a hurdle for
F. the guarantee of
Show
Hide
